author: WILSON ALEXANDER | Staff writer
title: Another LSU cornerback has reportedly entered the transfer portal after rocky season
text:
After a rocky season in which he started three games, LSU cornerback Denver Harris entered the transfer portal Thursday, according to multiple reports.
Harris, a sophomore who transferred from Texas A&M, was away from the team the last five games of the season for undisclosed reasons and was not going to play in the ReliaQuest Bowl. He had seven tackles and two pass breakups this season.
LSU coach Brian Kelly said earlier this month he would have conversations with Harris and junior cornerback Duce Chestnut about their futures with the program after the semester ended.
Chestnut entered the transfer portal Tuesday.
Harris was a five-star recruit in the 2022 class. He played significant snaps as a true freshman in five of Texas A&M's first six games, but then he was indefinitely suspended and did not play again for the Aggies. Though Harris transferred to LSU, he continued to deal with disciplinary issues.
At one point in preseason camp, Harris did not appear in a team picture and missed a week of practice. After he did not travel to the season opener against Florida State,
Harris started three straight games. He only appeared in two more the rest of the year.

author: Cpl. Dean Gurule
title: MARFORK Promotion Ceremony [Image 4 of 9]
text:
U.S. Marine Corps Sgt. Jason Santiagobirriel, a logistics embark specialist with U.S. Marine Corps Forces Korea, is promoted to the rank of Staff Sergeant during a promotion ceremony at U.S. Army Garrison Humphreys, Republic of Korea, May 6th, 2024. MARFORK is the U.S. Marine Corps Service component for United States Forces Korea and United Nations Command. MARFORK commands all U.S. Marine Forces assigned to USFK and UNC; as well as advises on the Marine Corps capabilities, support and proper employment of Marine Forces. (U.S. Marine Corps photo by Cpl. Dean Gurule)

author: @francagiansol
title: Papa Francesco, il governo ospedaliero di Bergoglio: rimosso vescovo in Canada per abusi. Poi dispone sul Giub
text:
Papa Francesco governa dal Gemelli. I ritmi sono adeguati al suo stato, non si deve affaticare, i segretari però provvedono a raccogliere le indicazioni del pontefice da trasferire alla curia. In questa catena di comando "ospedaliera" ha rimosso un vescovo canadese accusato di abusi - Blais - e nominato il successore.
Monsignor Blais, 75 anni, è menzionato nell'elenco degli aggressori sessuali su una vittima di 12 anni. «Palpeggiamenti e masturbazione». Blais ha sempre formalmente negato qualsiasi comportamento inappropriato. La sostituzione da parte del Papa avviene comunque dopo aver superato la soglia di età per il pensionamento, i 75 anni.
Papa Francesco, come sta? Notte tranquilla dopo l'infezione polimicrobica. Bruni: «Ha riposato, poi colazione e lettura giornali. Annullata l'udienza giubilare di sabato
Papa Francesco e il governo "ospedaliero"
La stanza papale in cui era stato precedentemente ricoverato Bergoglio è costantemente tenuta sotto controllo da un doppio cordone di sicurezza, nessuno si può avvicinare se non il personale medico autorizzato o i pochissimi collaboratori ammessi. Riposo assoluto, significa proprio questo, dare modo al Papa ottantottenne di riprendersi, cosa che sta andando avanti in modo lento e graduale. La cosa positiva è che non ha bisogno di ossigeno poiché respira autonomamente (autoventilazione).
«Stamattina non ho grandi notizie da darvi, posso dire che la notte il Papa la ha trascorsa bene, ha riposato e quando si è svegliato ha fatto la colazione e si è dedicato alla lettura di alcuni giornali» ha riferito il portavoce Matteo Bruni, specificando che al momento non ci sono informazioni mediche nuove. Stazionario, dunque, esattamente come ieri.
Papa Francesco: «Ho bisogno di cure», e salta il suo primo Angelus. L'assenza di immagini e il «pre-conclave»
La situazione
Ci sono i segretari papali che fanno la spola tra il Vaticano e il decimo piano del Gemelli, lo informano delle questioni più importanti che necessitano disposizioni, tuttavia è chiaro che in queste condizioni il modo di lavorare non può che essere adeguato a questa situazione emergenziale, quindi non vi sono carichi di lavoro incalzanti o stressanti, tuttavia si guardano alcune mail, qualche lettera, si risponde ai messaggi più rilevanti. Francesco affida ai collaboratori le disposizioni che poi questi riversano sulla struttura vaticana in un secondo momento, consentendo comunque al pontefice di avere sotto controlla la macchina burocratica curiale. Ha disposto, per esempio, che domenica mattina sia monsignor Rino Fisichella ad ordinare i nuovi diaconi e a celebrare la messa del Giubileo dei Diaconi a San Pietro, ha nominato un altro vescovo, stavolta del Canada.
Francesco non si alza da letto ma non necessita di ossigeno. Mangia normalmente (ovviamente si tratta di dieta ospedaliera) e non riceve visite e nemmeno va in giro per i reparti. Per l'Angelus di domenica si vedrà, non sono ancora state prese decisioni: il Vaticano si adeguerà in base al parere medico e allo stato di salute del pontefice.

author: Koushik Narayanan
title: Shahid Afridi laments Haris Rauf opting for BBL 2023 instead of PAK vs AUS
text: Former Pakistan all-rounder Shahid Afridi rekindled the debate surrounding pacer Haris Rauf and his participation in BBL 2023 instead of the PAK vs AUS Tests. Earlier in December, the PCB had given a NOC to the fiery pacer to play in the BBL after he had decided to pull out of the Test series against Australia. PAK vs AUS: Afridi wants Rauf in whites Speaking at the MCG, Shahid Afridi said that Rauf should have played the Test series instead of BBL 2023. The former cricketer highlighted that the pacer would have performed well in the conditions, given the speed he possesses. Further, Afridi claimed that Rauf would have enjoyed himself on the pitches that were prepared by Australia in Perth and Melbourne. “I think Haris [Rauf] should be part of this side instead rather than [the BBL],” Afridi, speaking to media at the MCG, said.” In these conditions, the kind of pace he has, he would have performed well and enjoyed himself on the kinds of pitches Australia prepared in Perth and here.” Also Read: Final Frontier remains unconquered Ajinkya Rahane & Cheteshwar Pujara could have been game-changers in South Africa SKY out, Hardik out, Rohit not interested, Who will lead India in Afghanistan T20Is? Indian batsmen’s poor numbers in South Africa a worry, Sarfaraz Khan becomes must

author: TOI World Desk
title: Watch: Not ICBM, Russia fired missile that travels at '10 times the speed of sound' - Times of India
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin announced on Thursday that Russia had deployed a new hypersonic intermediate-range ballistic missile, the Oreshnik, against Ukraine. This missile, he claimed was capable of reaching speeds ten times faster than sound, struck a military-industrial facility in the central Ukrainian city of Dnipro. Putin claimed that even advanced Western air defence systems in Europe would be powerless against it.“Modern air defense systems that exist in the world and anti-missile defenses created by the Americans in Europe can’t intercept such missiles,” Reuters reported quoting the Russian president. Speaking in a televised address, Putin justified the attack as a response to Ukraine’s use of US and British-supplied missiles to strike Russian territory earlier in the week. He warned that Russia would retaliate “decisively and in kind” against any further strikes, even hinting at targeting NATO nations supplying such weapons.— Tablesalt13 (@Tablesalt13) What is the Oreshnik missile?The Oreshnik is part of Russia’s growing hypersonic arsenal. It is an intermediate-range ballistic missile capable of travelling up to 5,500 kilometres (3,400 miles), carrying either conventional or nuclear warheads. The missile is reportedly based on Russia's RS-26 Rubezh missile model, an experimental system designed for both conventional and nuclear payloads. Putin described it as a response to the US deployment of similar intermediate-range ballistic missiles in Europe.The missile strike on Dnipro carried multiple warheads, making use of a technology known as a Multiple Independently-targetable Reentry Vehicle (MIRV). MIRVs allow a missile to deploy multiple warheads, each targeting different locations, increasing the missile's effectiveness in delivering large-scale damage with a single launch. This marks a significant development, as MIRVs were originally developed for nuclear warheads but were used in this instance with conventional weapons.Video footage of the strike showed multiple fiery trails followed by explosions, suggesting the use of multiple warheads. While Russia’s claims about its military technology often invite scepticism, analysts agreed the missile poses a significant challenge to air defence systems. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy condemned the missile’s deployment, calling it “a brutal escalation and a cynical violation of international law.” He urged global leaders to respond firmly to Russia’s actions, warning that failure to act decisively could embolden Putin. Meanwhile, US officials, speaking anonymously, downplayed the long-term significance of the missile, noting that Russia likely has only a limited number of these experimental weapons. However, the attack has heightened concerns about the war’s trajectory, with UK Defence Secretary John Healey describing the situation as “a serious moment” and accusing Russia of escalating attacks on civilian and energy infrastructure. The missile strike comes as the Biden administration approved Ukraine’s use of longer-range Western missiles inside Russia. This decision, criticised by Moscow, coincides with reports of North Korean troops bolstering Russian forces in the conflict zone. Putin has also revised Russia’s nuclear doctrine, allowing for a potential nuclear response to conventional attacks by any country supported by nuclear powers. Despite this, White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre dismissed suggestions that the US policy shift could provoke further escalation, maintaining that Russia’s actions were the real source of heightened tensions.

author: Il Resto del Carlino
title: Festival del dialetto di Varano: "Ecco il programma del rilancio"
text:
La presentazione di ieri a Palazzo del Popolo ad Ancona
Il Festival del Dialetto di Varano continua il suo rilancio, dopo la parentesi pandemica, con quattro giorni di spettacoli teatrali , cucina tradizionale , vini locali e giochi popolari , dal 31 luglio al 3 agosto. "Abbiamo settanta volontari che ci danno una mano a rendere più bello il nostro paese sul cucuzzolo – ha sostenuto la presidente del Comitato Manifestazioni Varanesi, Lucia Gioia, nella conferenza stampa di ieri, a Palazzo del Popolo di Ancona – in particolare è motivo di orgoglio vedere tanti giovani che aspettano l’inizio del festival. Fondamentale anche l’aiuto dell’amministrazione comunale, naturalmente."
"Il Comune di Ancona – ha confermato l’assessore alla Partecipazione Democratica, Daniele Berardinelli – ha concesso il proprio patrocinio e sostenuto la manifestazione, sia con l’assessorato di mia competenza, sia con quelli ai Grandi eventi, alle Politiche giovanili e all’Economia della notte. Il pubblico avrà a disposizione un servizio di bus navetta dallo stadio del Conero a Varano e viceversa durante la manifestazione, ogni giorno dalle ore 18 alle 23 circa, per tutta la durata del festival".
Il programma degli spettacoli teatrali è stato presentato dalla direttrice artistica, Orietta De Grandis, segretaria regionale del Gruppo Attività Teatrali (GAT) Marche, un altro degli enti che sostengono la manifestazione, insieme alla Regione Marche, alla Confartigianato e agli sponsor privati, tra cui i principali sono agenzia Lucangeli & Bonvenuti e BCC Ancona e Falconara. La prima ad andare in scena sarà una compagnia di Macerata, Palcoscenico, con la commedia "Sulu um miraculu li putia fa rrenzavi" (31/7). Seguirà la commedia "Da giovedì a giovedì" del gruppo teatrale Il Focolare di Loreto (1/8). La compagnia Gli amici del teatro di Loro Piceno rappresenterà "Per chi suona il campanello?" (2/8). Chiuderà la rassegna, domenica 3 agosto, "Na cagnara al Forte", farsa in anconetano, il cui testo fu premiato nella XVII edizione del Festival di Varano e che, dopo trent’anni, sarà diretta dall’autore, Andrea Toppi, con la compagnia Eureka di Ancona. Tutti gli spettacoli inizieranno alle ore 21.30, prezzo 5 euro, 500 posti disponibili. Biglietti acquistabili nel luogo e nel giorno dello spettacolo, a partire dalle ore 19.
Varano, però, non è solo il "paese dei dialetti", ma è anche terra di rosso Conero. Nel 2024 si è formato, proprio per il Festival, il gruppo "Artigiani vignaioli di Varano", composto da Alberto Serenelli, Il Mandorlo, Lanari, Ballarini e Fattoria Lucesole, che anche quest’anno, a partire dalle ore 18, apriranno i propri stand per "offrirare degustazioni in piazzetta", come segnala il ventiseienne Michele Ferrato dell’agriturismo Il Mandorlo. E a uno storico vignaiolo locale sarà dedicata la chisura del Festival: domenica 3, dalle 22.30, "A cena con Alberto" darà la possibilità di ascoltare i segreti di Alberto Serenelli, tra un piatto di pasta e un calice di vino (per prenotare telefonare alle singole aziende oppure scrivere nelle pagine social "Artigiani vignaioli di Varano"). Non manca una ricca offerta enogastronomica con tutte le sere piatti tipici marchigiani cucinati dalle donne varanesi e l’intrattenimento con "Il gioco della ruota" e le Sibille.
© Riproduzione riservata
topics: Arts, Culture and Entertainment->customs and tradition

author: Bill Kaczaraba
title: Seattle University and Cornish College of the Arts planning to join forces
text:
MYNORTHWEST NEWS
Seattle University and Cornish College of the Arts planning to join forces Dec 5, 2024, 2:07 PM | Updated: 3:41 pm
Seattle University sign. (Photo: Flickr)
(Photo: Flickr)
Share
BY BILL KACZARABA
MyNorthwest Content Editor
Seattle University and Cornish College of the Arts are planning to unite.
The two institutions have signed a Letter of Intent (LOI) and Cornish will become the Cornish College of the Arts at Seattle University (SU).
“Seattle University joining forces with Cornish will combine two storied Seattle institutions of higher learning into one,” SU President Eduardo Peñalver said in a written announcement. “It will create incredible new opportunities for our students to expand their educational horizons and for faculty to pursue innovative interdisciplinary collaborations.”
UW: Artificial Intelligence is headed towards doctors’ offices and it is not always a good thing
SU said that Cornish would continue to operate at its South Lake Union campus. Cornish says in its mission statement: “The mission of Cornish College of the Arts is to provide students aspiring to become practicing artists with an educational program of the highest possible quality, in an environment that nurtures creativity and intellectual curiosity, while preparing them to contribute to society as artists, citizens, and innovators.”
“We are excited about the prospect of joining with such a well-respected and mission-driven institution to provide a robust fine arts education in downtown Seattle and continue the mission of our founder, Nellie Cornish, who believed in education through exposure to all the arts,” Cornish College of the Arts Interim President Emily Parkhurst said in a statement.
The boards of trustees at both institutions have approved the LOI, marking the first step in the process. SU and Cornish College will conduct a thorough review of Cornish’s finances, holdings, operations, and compliance before a final decision is made.
KIRO Newsradio: Charlie Harger to replace Dave Ross as host of ‘Seattle’s Morning News’
“It is important to stress that today’s announcement represents just the beginning of a lengthy process as we work out the details of the combination of our two complex institutions,” Peñalver said in the statement. SU’s mission statement is: “Seattle University is dedicated to educating the whole person, to professional formation, and to empowering leaders for a just and humane world.”
The move to full integration will involve several steps over the next two years. SU will undertake a thorough due diligence review of Cornish’s finances, holdings, and operations. Once that is complete, SU will become the controlling entity of Cornish, expected by the end of May 2025. During the transition, Cornish will retain its separate degree-granting authority, accreditation, and federal student aid participation.
A final agreement is expected by spring 2025. The deal needs approval from the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU) and the Department of Education.
The announcement follows SU receiving a $300 million art collection from philanthropist Richard Hedreen.
Bill Kaczaraba is a content editor at MyNorthwest. You can read his stories here . Follow Bill on X, formerly known as Twitter, here and email him here .
Share

author: chinanews
title: 各地各部门积极行动防汛防台风及地质灾害救灾 争分夺秒抢险救援-中新网
text:
各地各部门积极行动防汛防台风及地质灾害救灾 争分夺秒抢险救援 分享到： → 分享到： 各地各部门积极行动防汛防台风及地质灾害救灾 争分夺秒抢险救援 2025-07-10 13:58:14 来源： 央视网 作者：胡寒笑 责任编辑：胡寒笑 2025年07月10日 13:58　来源：央视网 大字体 小字体 分享到： 　　央视网消息：我国西南、华北部分地区出现了强降雨天气，造成交通受阻、人员被困等情况。对此，各地各部门积极应对，争分夺秒展开抢险救援。
　　受台风“丹娜丝”影响，从9日凌晨开始，福建宁德多地出现强降雨天气。据统计，截至9日6时，宁德共有5个县(市、区)26个乡镇24小时累计雨量超过100毫米。其中，最大雨量出现在漳湾镇，达155.5毫米。受此影响，漳湾镇多处出现积水内涝，相关部门紧急开展抢险工作。
　　受台风“丹娜丝”影响，浙江台州三门县大横渡村的多名村民8日在山中遇暴雨涨水，被困山中无法返回，而此时，河水还在不断上涨。危急时刻，两名消防员在穿戴防护装备后，立即驾驶橡皮艇前往河对岸，抛出救援绳，搭建起救援通道。经过接力救援，7名被困人员全部脱困，所幸身体均无大碍。
　　这两天，我国西南地区多地也遭遇了大范围强降雨天气。从7月8日7时开始到9日7时，云南省昭通市威信县和镇雄县普降暴雨，其中，威信县最大降水量达227.8毫米。据初步统计，截至9日7时，威信县道路坍塌受损200余处、交通中断40余处、房屋被淹150余户。当地第一时间启动应急救援预案，抢险救援。
　　8日晚到9日清晨，贵州遵义习水县遭遇强降雨袭击，导致县城多处低洼地带积水严重，道路被淹、房屋进水，多名群众被困。当地消防部门展开救援，但因部分地区通道狭窄，舟艇无法通行，消防人员将绳索系在身上，涉水进入民房展开搜救。
　　经过仔细搜寻，消防人员在房屋二楼发现7名被困人员，其中包括一名行动不便的老人。在做好安全防护措施后，消防人员将老人背出，并转移至安全地带，随后又陆续将其余被困人员救出。
　　重庆也受到强降雨的影响。在大渡口区钢花路红楼医院附近，消防人员发现一名摩托车骑手被困水中，有被冲走的危险。经过救援，该男子被转移至安全地带。据介绍，目前，大渡口区消防救援局共处置相关警情16起，出动130余人次参与救援工作。
　　四川宜宾：多地遭遇强降雨 紧急救援转移被困群众
　　7月8日19时至7月9日9时，四川省宜宾市局部出现大暴雨天气，部分地区中雨到小雨。9日上午，宜宾市气象台将暴雨蓝色预警升级为暴雨黄色预警。长宁县、江安县、高县等地启动防汛四级应急响应。强降雨导致多人被困，当地全力组织救援。
　　在宜宾珙县上罗镇，街道积水已经有一米多深，部分地方积水已淹没一楼，有不少群众被困，救援人员在齐腰深的积水中采取接力方式转移被困群众。在一楼淹没区域，消防救援人员通过架设爬梯，将被困在二楼的群众转移至橡皮艇，送往安全区域。强降雨还导致珙县曹营镇、罗渡苗族乡等地出现大范围停电，部分道路因积水无法通行，通信出现异常。
　　截至9日14时，当地降雨已停，正在有序组织清淤和灾情核查。
　　财政部、应急管理部紧急预拨1.5亿元资金支持6省份防汛防台及地质灾害救灾
　　7月9日，财政部、应急管理部紧急预拨1.5亿元中央自然灾害救灾资金，重点支持浙江、福建、四川、重庆、西藏、甘肃6省(区、市)开展灾害应急抢险救援和受灾群众救助工作，统筹做好搜救转移安置受灾人员、排危除险等应急处置、次生灾害隐患排查、倒损民房修复等工作。
